    Splits a formula into a left and right side

    parse.formula.Rd

    This function splits a reaction formulka apart into its parts, removing whitespace on each side: "A + 2 B <=> AB2" will be split into a list with two entries

    Usage

    parse.formula(reactionFormula)

    Arguments

    string

    • reactionFormula

    Value

    a named list with a forward component and a backward component, each entry contains a character vector

    Details

    list$reactants == c("A","2*B")
list$products == c("AB2")

    On this page

    Developed by Alexandra Jauhiainen, Olivia Eriksson, Federica Milinanni, Andrei Kramer.
